column2: Companion data with the paper "Investigating the impact of adopting Python and C languages for introductory engineering programming courses" submitted to Computer Applications in Engineering Education Journal. If you use this data, please include a reference to the paper.
S1 - Did you have previous programming knowledge before the course?
column3: S2.1 - How confident are you about your programming skills for problem-solving in general?
column4: S2.2 - How confident are you about your programming skills for problem-solving in your study field?
column5: S3.1 - How difficult you found the topic "basic algorithm and programming"?
column6: S3.2 - How difficult you found the topic "sequential programming"?
column7: S3.3 - How difficult you found the topic "selection programming"?
column8: S3.4 - How difficult you found the topic "iterative programming"?
column9: S3.5 - How difficult you found the topic "basic data structures"?
column10: S3.6 - How difficult you found the topic "sub-programming"?
column11: S3.7 - How difficult you found the topic "structured data types" or "classes and objects"?
column12: S3.8 - How difficult you found the topic "text files"?
column13: S4.1 - How dedicated were you along the course regarding the theory classes?
column14: S4.2 - How dedicated were you along the course regarding the practice classes?
column15: S5 - How likely are you to keep on studying programming?
